points.heading: JavaScript overview
points.summary: JavaScript is a high-level, dynamic, and interpreted programming language used to create interactive and dynamic websites.

points.heading: Origins of JavaScript
points.summary: JavaScript was created by Brendan Eich in just 10 days in May 1995 while he was working at Netscape Communications Corporation.

points.heading: Usage
points.summary: JavaScript can be used for both front-end and back-end development, as well as for building mobile applications.

points.heading: Core technologies
points.summary: JavaScript is one of the three core technologies used for web development, along with HTML and CSS.

points.heading: Object-oriented and functional language
points.summary: JavaScript is an object-oriented and functional programming language.

points.heading: Manipulating the DOM
points.summary: One of the key features of JavaScript is its ability to manipulate the Document Object Model (DOM) of a web page.

points.heading: Vast ecosystem of libraries and frameworks
points.summary: JavaScript has a vast ecosystem of libraries and frameworks, such as React, Angular, Vue.js, Node.js, and Express.js.

points.heading: Constantly evolving
points.summary: JavaScript is constantly evolving, with new features and improvements being added regularly.

points.heading: Latest version
points.summary: The latest version of JavaScript is ECMAScript 2022, which includes features like enhanced modules and improved error handling.
